creator: bnsbr@tecnolink.com.br
text:
When building ant 1.5.1 release in OS/390 its show an error:

"BUILD FAILED"
"file:/u/b694079/ant/build.xml:655: Default manifest is invalid !!"

I checked the build.xml file and the line its refer, is the start of a jar task 
to build "ant.jar" file. I tried to send the manifest file to mainframe in 
ASCII and in EBCDIC format to see if this is a problem with encoding, but got 
the same error.
I use IBM JDK 1.3.1 at OS/390.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Could you try a build from CVS head? I have recently fixed a bug so that
Manifests are read with UTF-8 encoding.
I don´t know how do this. Can I download the tar file with all the source ?
creator: bnsbr@tecnolink.com.br
conor@apache.org
text:
Sure, get one from here
http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-ant/nightly/2003-02-17/

I think that should include the fix.

creator: conor@apache.org

text:
OK, I think I know where the problem is. When the default manifest is copied in
the build it is being converted into the platform default encoding which is
presumably EBCDIC. I'll need to adjust the build file for this. Actually a
slight problem since copy does not support encoding information. Give me a few days.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
Ok. This is the step where the build will create the "ant.jar" file, Ok ? Can I 
jar it with the command line tool ? It will work ?
creator: bnsbr@tecnolink.com.br
bnsbr@tecnolink.com.br
text:
I think I solved the problem. I modified the Manifest task, the method 
getDefaultManifest(), there you use a InputStream in ASCII mode to copy the 
manifest file. I removed the "ASCII" param at the call for the constructor and 
it worked. Now the build process is Ok. But I got one error with the "ant" 
and "antRun" files at bootstrap/bin, I think they are created in ASCII and 
because of it they are invalid. I workout this sending to Mainframe the ant and 
antRun file generated at Windows. Sending they as text to Mainframe cause the 
conversion to EBCDIC. So, the only problem is the generated ant and antRun file.
Betwen, I have read at specification of ant that when you dont inform the place 
that ant dist should be installed the ant dist is generated in ANT_HOME dir, 
that is on enviroment variable. But this didn't work.

I've updated the build to preserve the manifest's UTF-8 encoding. Could you try
that when the next nightly buld is available. (Please follow the links from
ant.apache.org since we have just moved the nightly builds - The link is
currently disabled. It will be re-enabled when the next build is available ~24
hours).

If that fixes the manifest problem from a fresh checkout, we can move onto the
next issue(s) you have. I'd suggest we close this bug then and open new ones for
the new issues since this bug is already quite large.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
Have you done a clean? Just need to make sure we have a UTF-8 version of the
default manifest.
creator: conor@apache.org
bnsbr@tecnolink.com.br
text:
How can I make sure about it ? What is the default manifest file ? Is the file 
at /src/etc ? or at /src/main/org/apache/tools/ant ?
I send to the mainframe as binary or as text ?

To clean, delete the bootstrap and build directories and start build again. The
default manifest is in /src/main/org/apache/tools/ant. It should be a UTF-8 file
(plain ASCII is fine here)
creator: conor@apache.org
bnsbr@tecnolink.com.br
